data.title: Artful Dodger Songs

data.text:
Artful Dodger is a legendary musical artist that has inspired many music lovers with his unique sound. He is celebrated for his contributions to the garage and two-step genre, as well as his influence in the UK music industry. A name like Artful Dodger is not one that you hear every day, but what is his story? Where did he come from, and how did he become a legend? This article is going to take you on a journey through Artful Dodger's musical biography, from his beginnings, his most famous albums, his most famous songs, and a brief description of his artistic style and influences.

Blog Body: Artful Dodger, whose real name is Mark Hill, was born on August 22, 1972. He grew up in Southampton, England, where he developed his love for music. Hill began his musical career as a DJ, playing in clubs and bars in his hometown. However, he didn't start producing music until the early 1990s when he met another aspiring DJ and producer, Pete Devereux, at a local record shop. The two DJs formed a musical duo, which they called the Artful Dodger.

In 1999, Artful Dodger released their debut album, It's All About The Stragglers. The album featured several hit singles, including Movin' Too Fast and Re-Rewind (The Crowd Say Bo Selecta). These songs dominated the UK music charts at the time, and they propelled Artful Dodger to popularity.

Artful Dodger's musical style is a combination of UK garage, two-step, and R&B. His music has a unique sound that is heavily influenced by the UK club scene. One of Artful Dodger's most significant contributions to music is helping to popularize garage and two-step music in the UK. He has influenced many musicians who came after him, including Craig David and So Solid Crew.

Artful Dodger's second album, It's A Secret, was released in 2003. Although the album didn't perform as well as their first album, it produced hits such as Think About Me and Outrageous. The duo also contributed to the soundtrack for the film About A Boy, which featured the hit song TwentyFourSeven.

One of Artful Dodger's most famous songs is Re-Rewind (The Crowd Say Bo Selecta). The song features the vocals of Craig David and it is a classic garage and two-step tune. Another popular Artful Dodger song is Movin' Too Fast, which features the vocals of Romina Johnson. The song has an infectious beat and is considered a garage anthem.

Conclusion: In conclusion, Artful Dodger is a legend in the UK music industry, and his contributions to the garage and two-step genre have inspired many musicians. As we have seen, he started his musical career as a DJ playing in bars and clubs in Southampton, England, before meeting Pete Devereux and forming Artful Dodger. Their debut album, It's All About The Stragglers, produced hits such as Movin' Too Fast and Re-Rewind (The Crowd Say Bo Selecta), cementing Artful Dodger's place in music history. Although the duo's second album, It's A Secret, didn't perform as well, they still contributed to the soundtrack for the hit film About A Boy. Artful Dodger's unique sound, which combines UK garage, two-step, and R&B, has influenced many musicians and continues to do so. Artful Dodger is a name that will always be associated with great music and a groundbreaking UK garage scene.
